description: From Middle English prisoner, from Old French prisonier (compare Medieval Latin prisōnārius), equivalent to prison +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: A person incarcerated in a prison, while on trial or serving a sentence.
Any person held against their will.
A person who is or feels confined or trapped by a situation or a set of circumstances.
examples: I am no longer a prisoner to fear, for I am a child of God.
